alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight; Southampton; Suffolk (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Isle of Wight, and Southampton Counties, the City of Franklin and the southwestern City of Suffolk through 645 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newsoms, or near Courtland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Courtland, Suffolk, Ivor, Newsoms, Hunterdale, Sedley, Carrsville, Vicksville, Handsom, Berlin, Manry, Cleopus, Collosse, Dory, Sunbeam, Lees Mill, Riverdale, Walters and Sebrell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
